channel.title: How To Find Remembered Firefox Passwords
channel.description:
OK this is pretty easy to do and most people probably know about it but here it goes...
OK first open up Mozilla Firefox and click [b]TOOLS[/b] then [b]OPTIONS[/b] [img]http://img244.imageshack.us/img244/1061/toolsoptionsxo2.png[/img]
Now click [b]SECURITY[/b] then [b]SHOW PASSWORDS...[/b] [img]http://img133.imageshack.us/img133/5206/secpasspb3.png[/img] a pop-up will then appear its should look like this [img]http://img133.imageshack.us/img133/2952/secpassht6.png[/img]
Click [b]SHOW PASSWORDS[/b] it will ask you 'are you sure blah blah blah' click yes
and there are the passwords :)
this works great at my school because people click yes and don;t notice what there clicking yes to (being them saving there passes)
[center][sub]MADE BY MVP566//DYLAN//RS2ARMOR.COM//RS2ARMOR.ORG//RS2WORLDSWITCHER.NET[/sub][/center]

item.title: How To Find Remembered Firefox Passwords
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

bullzeye:

Your school doesn’t know about FF? Hell, my teachers are complete morons when it comes to computers! You know when it asks you to activate something (like linerider, or example), well my teachers think they’re clicking on play, when they’re actually activating it. They get all mad cause they think it’s taking 5 minutes to load. Idiots…

Lmao…I’d have a good bit of fun watching them get mad over that.

Read full topic

item.description:
@mvp566 wrote:

OK this is pretty easy to do and most people probably know about it but here it goes…

OK first open up Mozilla Firefox and click TOOLS then OPTIONS

Now click SECURITY then SHOW PASSWORDS… a pop-up will then appear its should look like this

Click SHOW PASSWORDS it will ask you ‘are you sure blah blah blah’ click yes

and there are the passwords

this works great at my school because people click yes and don;t notice what there clicking yes to (being them saving there passes)
